page.title: 08Bretton Hall College.
page.content: Bretton Hall once belonged to a rich family called the Beaumonts.It is a big house with a park around it. In 1949 it was sold to the West Riding County Council to become a college of the arts.There are eight hundred students working there at the moment.Some are going to be teachers.Others are studying arts subjects like painting, music and drama, and taking other short courses. We met Mr. Pearce, a lecturer, in the stable block and sat round a big table to ask questions. Then we went for a walk in the park.We ran through the long grass by the lake and onto a bridge.We went back through the Yorkshire Sculpture Park and saw some of the sculptures.
